docs.snippet: The role played by the Cuban Finance Minister Ernesto (Che) Guevara at the hemispheric conference in Punta del Este, Uruguay, has been interesting. It contrasts sharply with the role played by the Cuban Economic Minister Regino Boti, at a similar...
docs.lead_paragraph: The role played by the Cuban Finance Minister Ernesto (Che) Guevara at the hemispheric conference in Punta del Este, Uruguay, has been interesting. It contrasts sharply with the role played by the Cuban Economic Minister Regino Boti, at a similar conference held in Bogota, Colombia, in September, 1960.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 -- President Kennedy's foreign-aid bill suffered severe setbacks in both houses of Congress today.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 -- President Kennedy's foreign-aid bill suffered severe setbacks in both houses of Congress today.
docs.abstract: Sen, 51-43 and 57-37 respectively, approves Ellender amendments to cut borrowing authority to $8 billion and to cut mil aid $1/4 billion; other actions; HR, 197-185, approves Saund amendment to deny borrowing authority and to authorize $1.2 billion for development loans

headline.main: PRESIDENT MEETS SETBACKS ON AID IN BOTH HOUSES; Senate Trims Military Funds -- House Rejects Request to Borrow From Treasury PRESIDENT MEETS SETBACKS ON AID

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Aug. 17 -- Severe economic measures have been threatened against Cuban workers who fail to learn to read and write by the end of this year.
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Aug. 17 -- Severe economic measures have been threatened against Cuban workers who fail to learn to read and write by the end of this year.
docs.abstract: Cuban Workers Confed proposes severe econ steps against workers failing to learn to read and write by end of '61; Premier Castro repts 6% of over 59% more get instruction

headline.main: CUBA IS PRESSING LITERACY DRIVE; Workers Told to Learn or Face Job Restrictions

docs.snippet: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, Aug. 17 -- The United States and all the Latin-American countries with the exception of Cuba signed today the Charter of the Alliance for Progress, a ten-year program to carry forward a democratically planned economic and...
docs.lead_paragraph: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, Aug. 17 -- The United States and all the Latin-American countries with the exception of Cuba signed today the Charter of the Alliance for Progress, a ten-year program to carry forward a democratically planned economic and social revolution.
docs.abstract: Alliance objectives outlined; conf hailed as success; only Guevara downcast; conf directs OAS to gather experts in 6 mos to aid in formulating natl soc reform programs

headline.main: All Except Cuba Sign Aid Plan; Delegates to Conference Jubilant; Alliance for Progress Meeting, Hailed as Success, Ends With Embraces -- Only Guevara Is Downcast

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 17 -- Uruguay for the first time in several years has sold almost its entire wool crop. As a result the country is enjoying a favorable balance of foreign trade, whereas for the last two years there had been trade deficits...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 17 -- Uruguay for the first time in several years has sold almost its entire wool crop. As a result the country is enjoying a favorable balance of foreign trade, whereas for the last two years there had been trade deficits of about $100,000,000 a year.
docs.abstract: Uruguay sells almost entire crop, enjoys 1st favorable trade balance in 2 yrs

headline.main: WOOL CROP SALE BOON TO URUGUAY; Favorable Balance of Trade Results From Disposals

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, Aug. 17 -- Secretary of the Treasury Douglas Dillon said here today that the United States had no intention of making any of its funds available to the Government of Cuba as long as that Government remained "under the control...
docs.lead_paragraph: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, Aug. 17 -- Secretary of the Treasury Douglas Dillon said here today that the United States had no intention of making any of its funds available to the Government of Cuba as long as that Government remained "under the control of" the Soviet Union.
docs.abstract: Alliance for Progress Charter approved by all nations except Cuba; illus; Guevara attacks Alliance as 'instrument of econ imperialism'; Dillon rules out US aid to Cuba as long as Cuba remains under USSR control, says Latin Amer nations would get aid through program in accordance with their attaining program objective cf soc benefits under repr democracy

headline.main: Dillon Rules Out U.S. Aid to Cuba; DILLON SAYS U.S. WON'T HELP CUBA

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 17 -- A street riot and the death of a bystander followed a talk by Maj. Ernesto Guevara, Cuba's Minister of Industry, at the University of Uruguay here tonight.

docs.abstract: Guevara visit at Uruguay U, Montevideo, causes riot and death of bystander; Govt Council member moves that Guevara be declared unwelcome

headline.main: GUEVARA VISST STIRS RIOT IN MONTEVIDEO

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 -- The United States is concerned over next Monday's elections in British, Guiana. Officials wonder whether the almost certain victory of the extreme Leftists there will push the territory into the Cuban sphere of influence.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 -- The United States is concerned over next Monday's elections in British, Guiana. Officials wonder whether the almost certain victory of the extreme Leftists there will push the territory into the Cuban sphere of influence.
docs.abstract: Election set; Jagan's People's Progressive party seen victor; US worried over his Leftist leanings; he says he will accept aid from any source without pol strings but expects it 1st from US and Commonwealth nations

headline.main: U.S. IS WATCHING GUIANA ELECTION; Concern Centers on Jagan, Leftist-Oriented Leader

byline.original: By TAD SZULC Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 18 -- Indonesia proposed today that a United Nations police force be sent into South-West Africa to protect the people of that territory against South Africa's practices of apartheid -- raised segregation.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 18 -- Indonesia proposed today that a United Nations police force be sent into South-West Africa to protect the people of that territory against South Africa's practices of apartheid -- raised segregation.
docs.abstract: UN com studies recommendations to Assembly; Indonesian member Karseno Sasmojo proposes sending UN police force to protect people against apartheid; com chmn Amb Rodriguez Fabregat urges preparing area for independence

headline.main: U.N. Police Unit Urged to Guard The People of South-West Africa
